content:  straight up reversible striped hat  a nerdyknitting pattern by nicole nehrig size infant child small adult large adult head sizes 14 16 17 19 20 22 23 24 infant and large adult sizes shown above gauge 20 sts = 4 in stockinette yarn 2 colors of worsted weight yarn such as cascade 220 madelinetosh vintage berroco ultra alpaca 20g 27g 34g 40g mc and 15g 20g 25g 30g cc needles us 6/4mm 16 circular us 6/4mm dpns or larger circular needle for magic loop us 5/3 75mm 16 circular optional to create a tighter rib on band you will also need a tapestry needle and 7 8 9 place markers one of which is different from the others to mark the start of the round 1 abbreviations mc= main color cc= contrast color 2x1 ribbing= k2 p1 sl1pwyif= slip one stitch as if to purl while holding the yarn in front of the work sm= slip marker k2tog= knit two stitches together instructions with mc cast on 72 84 96 108 stitches using us 6/4mm or us 5/3 75mm circular needle mark the beginning of your round with the unique place marker set up round join in the round and knit in 2x1 ribbing placing a marker after every 12 stitches note the marker will always follow a purl stitch after this round you will have a total of 6 7 8 9 markers placed ribbing complete the next 2 rounds with mc for a total of 4 4 5 6 times round 1 *knit in 2x1 ribbing until 1 stitch before marker sl1pwyif sm* repeat from * to end of round round 2 knit in 2x1 ribbing body of hat using us 6/4mm circular complete the next 2 rounds of stockinette stitch alternating colors until hat measures 5 5 5 6 6 5 from bottom of band round 1 cc *knit until 1 stitch before marker sl1pwyif sm* repeat from * to end of round round 2 mc *knit until 1 stitch before marker p1 sm* repeat from * to end of round decreases at crown complete the next 2 decrease rounds until 2 stitches remain between markers note change to dpns or magic loop when necessary round 1 cc *knit until 1 stitch before marker sl1pwyif sm* repeat from * to end of round round 2 mc *knit until 3 stitches before marker k2tog p1 sm* repeat from * to end of round for infant & child sizes only skip this last round of decreases and move on to finishing for adult sizes when 2 stitches remain between markers continue with round 1 as written on round 2 *k2tog* all the way around finishing break yarn leaving a 6 tail and thread it through the remaining stitches weave in ends and rock it inside and out this pattern is intended for private use only please do not reproduce this pattern or use it to make items for profit 2
